page.title: 01GAZETEER.
page.content: The "D Block" is a largely rural area of Hereford and Worcester approx. 12 miles south of Worcester lying in undulating land between the vallies of the rivers Severn and Avon. It is intensely farmed. It contains one sizeable settlement in the S.E. corner at Defford, pop. approx. 300. This is an ancient village mentioned in the original Domesday survey, but with much recent housing.There is a subsiduary settlement at Besford 2 miles to N. Major landmarks are the radar station on Defford Airfield and Croome Court former seat of the Earls of Coventry. The area is disected by the main Birmingham to Bristol railway although there are no extant stations. The M5 just intrudes into the S.W. corner. The block itself contains no major roads.
